dialogues.text: Brian turns off the dim light. Stephen's breathing deepen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't know... they don't know  what I hear in there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian tucks the blanket around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...This boat could be okay, huh?...  Take it out weekends... Sean 'n me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen's voice drifts off into sleep. Brian watches a mo the rare look of peace on his brother's face, then leaves

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark and still. Brian, carrying a roll of hose, scales th chain link.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is a practice stand-pipe. Brian counts down to himself, t rushes the stand-pipe, spinning off the cap with a hydran wrench and attaching the hose coupling. He does it again, over and over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky's gone pink and blue as Brian climbs back over th fence. Adcox, coming out of a donut shop across the stree sees him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A truck has JACKKNIFED across the avenue and SPILLED its  contents -- several THOUSAND baby chicks. They're scurryi everywhere as Brian's company tries to round them up. It' hopeless as the exhausted firemen stuff handfuls of the  cheeping cargo into their turn-out coats. There's ghetto  kids all around, grabbing at the chicks, grabbing at the  fire engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at kids) Hey! Knock it off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian stops a beat. Rubs his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Maybe you should have gotten more  sleep last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian looks at him. Does he mean what he thinks he means? Tim is coming out of a small store across the street. He  hands a small bag of groceries to Adcox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This everything you wanted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone grows suddenly silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fireman's without even saying so, "Petzold" on the mail Engine 17 parked out front. Brian's alone outside, cleani the diesel fuel off his arms. Watching a small kid playin with a toy fire truck in the drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim and Brian are loading the groceries into the fridge.  Stephen and Grindle are fixing a loose cabinet door as Ad sits caulking a faucet fitting at the kitchen table with young WOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Stephen) Can I help you guys at all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, we just about got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (noticing Adcox's  shirt) Sally must be finally ironing your  shirts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just new. Couple'a shifts and  it'll be as thrashed as the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sight of uniform is too much for her. Her eyes cloud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adcox reaches out and lets her weep on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss him... I just miss him,  y'know?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adcox stands out at the fire engine smoking a cigarette,  lost in himself, watching the little boy play with his to fire truck. Stephen's followed him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This job... This fuckin' job  sometimes... To buy it trying to go  the extra yard, man, that's one thing,  but to buy it just because there  wasn't any back-up... it's bullshit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen leans down close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's bullshit. So what? Fuck  Swayzak. Fuck 'em all. We don't go  into fires for them. You know that.  Christ, you taught me that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat of understanding between them. Stephen looks back the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Knowlton pretty well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Kind of an asshole, wasn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adcox can't help but smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biggest in two battalions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, smiles) We're gonna be okay, man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Brian and Tim scrub down the fire engine, the rest of company lies sprawled in

dialogues.speaker: THE STATION REC ROOM
dialogues.text: Watching a weepy soap. Schmidt walks through and is snare by the TV's glow. He hesitates. Shares the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she going to get the divorce?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs with honest  concern) Hell if I know, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ladderman, WASHINGTON, walks in with a memo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Pengelly, you made the captain's  list!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody clasps Pengelly on the shoulder. "Way to go". " right, man". Brian turns and sees Stephen out on the appa floor, watching. Watches. Pengelly's younger than him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An expanse of concrete lying out back of the station. Bui in one corner is the concrete shell of a five story train building, just wide enough for a stairway and room on eac level. Twenty yards away, Brian, Tim and Adcox stand read beside a pile of coiled hose rolls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at watch) Alright... Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim picks up a roll of hose, 50 pounds, throws it over hi shoulder and runs with Adcox to the foot of the building. There's a fixed standpipe that Adcox ties into as Tim dra the other end inside and up a flight of stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian lifts another hose roll under his arm and runs for building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That isn't a football, probie. Get  it on your shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian runs up two flights to meet Tim and connect his end Tim heads down for another roll as Brian drags his up ano two flights. It's a bitch. Sweating, he barrels back down the stairs, passing Tim co up with another roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having fun, fireman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim flips him off. Brian laughs and sprints for another r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not breaking any records,  Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian holds it under his arm and takes off. Stephen grabs roll himself, hoists it to his shoulder and runs alongsid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your shoulder. Like this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian lifts it to his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! Pick it up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come to the doorway. Instead of stopping, Stephen fo Brian in and runs alongside up the stairs. Without a word spoken it's become a race between them. Brian's face explodes in sweat. His heart pounds as they up flight after flight. The hose rolls weigh a 100 pounds thousand. Neck 'n neck all the way; grunting, their throa burning, only one flight from the roof Stephen STUMBLES a SCRAPES his leg. Brian pauses. Stephen's already back on feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run, damn you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian does, Stephen already gaining on him -- getting rea to pass him -- when they burst gasping out onto the roof, Brian the "winner" by a nose. Stephen drops his hose roll sticks his face into Brian's, -- And laughs. Unsure, Bria starts to join in. Stephen stops suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll the hose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, are you kidding? By myself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adcox and Tim, down below, have already disappeared back  into the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see now what Stephen apparently doesn't. He was scrape badly, his pant leg torn and leaking dark circles of bloo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, is it the stairs? Christ, I'll  let you win next time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Brian's face) You got a problem with drilling,  probie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Lt., I don't have a problem with  drilling. But let's just have one  drill. Not one for the company and  one for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roll the hose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen turns and walks away. Brian stands there watching him in blind fury, finally exploding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn you Stephen, I'm not gonna  quit. You hear me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward beat between them that's interrupted suddenly the station alarm klaxon. Stephen smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thank God for fires...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke and confusion. A MOTHER is screaming hysterically a Stephen as he jumps down from the engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing his coat) My baby! My baby's still up there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on a sec, Stevie, we got a  hoseline coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen doesn't even pause and enters the building. Brian hesitates a beat, then follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where they bomb up a staircase just as a WALL OF FIRE LAS DOWN, KNOCKING them on their ass. Stephen jumps to his fe with an axe as Brian struggles to get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't take that kind of shit from  it! Don't let it know you're scared!  Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen, with just his axe, CHASES up the stairs at the f HAMMERING at the flaming boards. The fire retreats into  another room, SLAMMING the door shut behind it. Brian struggles up the stairs. The two of them slide up o either side of the closed door, Stephen cradling his axe  like a SWAT team shotgun. The door breathes in and out an something animal scratches and snarls on the other side. Brian can feel the panic rising in his throat. That thing behind the door, that slobbering, evil thing. It wants ou It wants... him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, Stephen, let's wait for the  hose team...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to it, Brian... Jump when I  say... It won't get us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen HAMMERS the lock with his axe and KICKS the door  open. A WALL OF FLAME ROARS out past their cheeks, then  BACKWASHES in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen picks up the door, and using it as a shield CHARG into the flames. Brian tries to follow but the fire WELLS UP, cutting him off. He hesitates. It's that goddamn flam again, leering at him. Daring him. It BUCKS suddenly, DRO Brian to his knee. He GROANS in pain. -- And now Adcox and Grindle are coming up the stairs wit hoseline WASHING DOWN the room. Clouds of furious steam b out and across the ceiling. Nobody could be alive in ther Except Stephen. His entire outfit smoldering, he emerges  from the clouds like a fucking god, carrying in one arm a gasping child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of the firemen have gathered together for post-fire  coffee and stories. Brian sits off alone on the fire engi bumper, apart from them. Santos walks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They think she's gonna live...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen walks up. Sits down beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I waited... I would have fucking  waited...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what it's about, Brian.  The point is there was a kid in there.  And what if there'd been two? I went  in because that's what I do. It's my  way. It's dad's way. It isn't  everybody's way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad's way? Where did he tell you  that? In a fucking seance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you wanted to know something,  Brian. What did you learn today? (Brian doesn't answer) What do you say, Brian, huh? Time to  move on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian lingers only a moment before standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, Stephen... You win...  You're the best, man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian hands Stephen his helmet and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only six like it in city hall, and this one has a view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on intercom) Brian McCaffrey on line two for  Jennifer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take it in my office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to her and  smiles) Go get him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer comes out of Swayzak's office and walks down to own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- It's a tiny, bleak little rat hole. She picks up the  receiver...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Brian in his apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been thinking about what you  said the other night... If the offer's  still on the table, I'd like to talk  about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) ...Okay. I'll arrange things with  your assignment captain. (beat) Marty's a good man, Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian hangs up. He stares at it a moment, then SLAMS it  against the wall. Jennifer stares at the phone with something almost like  sadness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen drives past the burned-out brownstone that fried  Alan Seagrave. He parks in the alley behind, walks up the building, and PULLS OFF a plywood sheet covering a blown- window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen walks through the creepy, brutalized silence. Bac to where Rimgale had focused his investigation that night He searches the floor, the wall, looking for something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crumbling one in Chinatown. Brian checks the address on his slip of paper. He stands there a beat, hating himself

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a regular station but for the rear that has been  converted into arson squad offices. As Brian approaches t office door he can see Rimgale sitting at his desk. Stand nervously beside it is a fresh-faced, uniformed PROBIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to probie) ...So stop me if I get this wrong...  The fire's almost out... You're  upstairs on the unburned floor  checking for heat. You've been told  by your Battalion Chief, your Captain,  by me, not to do anything up there  until ordered. But now the itch  starts, and all of a sudden comes  the Glory Boy Flash: Hey, I'm a hero.  Heroes don't just stand around. So  on your own you decided to punch out  a window for ventilation. Was that  before or after you noticed you were  standing in a lake of gasoline?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid is dying a thousand deaths of humiliation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could've crispered half your  company with that little stunt, but  more importantly you wrecked the  physical evidence I use to prove  it's arson. You've made my day longer,  Probie. Go home and think about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid shuffles off hang-dog. Rimgale's angry gaze falls Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I'm Brian McCaffrey. Your new  assistant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Dennis' kid. (beat) I work alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Rimgale walks into his office, leaving Brian marooned the doorway. Stepping behind a small partition, Rimgale  changes his shirt. Brian can just glimpse from where he s a horrible burn that has consumed most of Rimgale's stoma Rimgale catches the look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you still here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get used to me, Inspector. I'm not  going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then go find a corner. I don't want  you in my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should get something  straight here. I was assigned to  this office by the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I knew your father, he had a  helluva reputation on this job. But  that don't mean you get any slack.  Swayzak sends you down here, okay, I  gotta eat you, that's the rules and  I got nothing to say about that. But  Swayzak or no, you live with me.  Step out of line, and I don't care  who knows you, I'll swing the hammer. (beat) You think you're the first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale glances at his watch, puts on his coat, and picks a small paper bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pest control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the face of RONALD, an unremarkable man in his 40s.  Unremarkable but for laser eyes and two heavily bandaged  hands. Go wide and find him sitting in an institutional c handcuffed, actually -- in an institutional hall. A unifo guard stands nearby as Brian and Rimgale come down the  corridor. Ronald smiles upon seeing Rimgale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How ya doin', Ronald. Staying  comfortable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't think you'd make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't miss this for the world,  pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at Brian) Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He works for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he a fireman? (smiles) I like firemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like everybody, Ronald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronald's eyes pick up Brian's name on his prison ID badge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian McCaffrey... (eyes light up happily) Oh this is really a treat. Brian  McCaffrey. Lost a dad to the animal,  huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heating up) Hey, do I know you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ronald) What the hell are you talking about  my --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale silences Brian with a threatening hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock it off. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him about me, Shadow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronald here likes telephones. Used  to tape wooden matches to the bell  striker and wrap it in cotton. Came  up with a whole little thing there,  didn't you Ronald? When you got bored,  what did you do? You just started  making calls... mostly day care  centers and retirement homes, wasn't  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he tell you how we finally met?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody cares, Ronald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, but it's a good story, Shadow.  You're depriving our famous young  friend here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... Ronald Bowland...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop helps Ronald to his feet and all four are marchin down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was on State Street, right?...  Just your basic warehouse torch for  the owner. Cakewalk. But the animal...  turned on me... 'Ol Shadow here, he  shows up -- whole place is going  like hell -- my hair, my hands...  could've just let the animal take me --  but Shadow, he's a good camper, so  he tries to pull 'ol Ronald out.  Guess he didn't notice the tub of  phosphorous next to me... (smiles) Notice you're still a little shy  about rolling your sleeves up, Shadow.  Show him your stomach yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronald in the hot seat before a parole board, Rimgale and Brian on the sidelines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...All right, the parole board has  received Mr. Bowland's fitness report,  his ID-44, endorsement from his  section warden... Dr. Norris?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As supervising psychiatrist I would  describe Mr. Bowland's progress as  remarkable. Taking into account his  disability and the six years already  served, I recommend parole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bowland, do you regret your  crimes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I understand now the pain I  caused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If released, will you commit these  crimes again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you consider yourself ready for  society?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parole board shuffles their papers. It's a done deal. Rimgale suddenly stands and approaches Ronald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure Ronald? You're ready alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Excuse me, Mr. Rimgale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. (to Ronald) What do you do with little girls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tortured look comes over Ronald's face. He's holding ba From the paper bag, Rimgale suddenly tosses a burned baby doll in his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you do with them, Ronald?  Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale then lights a cigarette lighter in Ronald's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) -- Burn them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And old ladies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Burn them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the world -- the whole world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) -- Burn it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parole board stares, stunned. Rimgale stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya next year, Ronald. Gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pre-war theatre closed with a sign: UNDER RENOVATION -- OPENING XMAS 1991. DAVID BENTON, mid-forties, climbs out his car and walks to the entrance with some rolled-up  blueprints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benton walks through the vast theatre and up to a beautif Art Noveau office door: DAVID BENTON, PRIVATE. He goes to insert his key. Drops it. As he reaches down, we see a ti wisp of smoke SUCK back under the door. Benton sniffs, as he smells something, then shrugs and inserts his key. It' have been a good story if he'd lived longer. The moment he pushes the door open It EXPLODES OUTWARD in ROARING FIREBALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later and engine companies have already knocked down the  building fire as Brian climbs out of Rimgale's red sedan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (opens trunk) Hey kid, c'mere -- At least make  yourself useful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts handing Brian handfuls of equipment cases. Load down, Brian follows Rimgale into the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire crews are at work in here, including Engine 17 at th other end of the theatre. Brian's surprised to see them, eyes locking briefly with Stephen's. An ENGINE COMPANY LT walks up to Rimgale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were lucky with this one. Could've  taken out the whole complex, but the  explosion blew out most of the flame.  Good for us. (looks to body) -- Not so good for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Him" is our previous owner, David Benton, just his hands and a leg showing from under the collapsed door. Rimgale  crouches beside it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn this over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian does. The corpse's keys are still in the lock. So's Benton. Blown with such force he seems fused with the doo On the door's edge Rimgale notices a small patch of melte sticky goo. With his penknife he scrapes a sample and sea it in a glass vial, stands, and walks into the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do with --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale, now inside, silences him with an outstretched ar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Shhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) What are you listening to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale doesn't answer. His eyes drift over the scorched  walls as he speaks softly to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sneaky little son of a bitch...  Hide and seek... Come on, tell me  what I want to know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scratches at some soot. Smiles and lifts a small hand  recorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (business-like into  recorder) Heavy smoke stains observed in entry  room. Demarkation line high. Fire  never got hot enough here to cook  soot off. It started somewhere else... (walks down hall) Less soot here. More heat. (they enter back room) And very little soot here. (to Brian) Get that couch out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian pulls it aside. The lower third of the wall is  completely untouched by soot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) So you were happy here. Warm and  cozy and in no hurry... (into recorder) Soot high, clean unburned wall low,  indicates slow burn in thermal  balance. (to Brian) Find me some glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we have a language barrier here?  Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's some on the sill of a blown window. Brian hands a shard to Rimgale, who turns it over in his palm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into recorder) Glass found in ignition room is in  small, thin pieces, indicating  explosion. Lack of discoloration  indicates a long, slow burn. Explosion  must of come after a slow burn. (shuts recorder off) You little tease... What were you up  to you little bastard, huh? What  made you that mad? (then, an idea) Or scared. (switches on recorder) It started in this room. Took its  time, hung out... but the air ran  out. It couldn't breathe. So it was  snuffed. But it wasn't dead... still  all that trapped heat, lying low,  waiting for some sucker to open the  door and give it that one gulp of  air...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Another backdraft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale turns to the wall, a section where the plaster is severely damaged. He probes with a penknife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finish coat burned away... Severe  spawling of rough coat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale follows the damaged wall down -- down -- to a mel wall socket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's our ignition point. Dig it  out. Carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian chops it out from the wall. Rimgale crouches down,  peels back the melted faceplate and examines the wires. T copper tip is severely melted. Rimgale sniffs the plug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into recorder) Temperature in this room was about  2000 degrees, but copper wire in  outlet is melted, which requires  5000 degrees. An accidental short in  the plug could of created a spark of  7000 degrees, hot enough to melt the  wire and start a fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it couldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale shuts off the recorder. Stares down Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean you'd be right -- with normal  wire. But that's gauge ten in that  plug -- industrial stuff. Who knows  why they put it in here -- but it  won't melt at less than 12,000  degrees. And no natural spark short  of lightning gets that hot. (Rimgale just stares) In another life I was in high-end  electronics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale opens a plastic bag and puts the plug inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into recorder) Have outlet analyzed for any traces  of flammable accelerants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale stands and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't mention it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian follows Rimgale down from the office into the vast  theatre. Walls hiss and spit. Brian's surprised to see hi former engine mates there, tromping and crunching their w through broken glass, their flashlights like dancing  fireflies. Tim passes by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Tim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody turns at the voice and the air suddenly chills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distant) Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Brian) Check the wall for burn patterns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Rimgale's off to another room. Brian turns and looks the wall. It's endless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tim) So, you surviving without me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no replacement 'cause of  your boss' cuts, if that's what you  mean. If someone else goes out on an  injury we're really screwed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swayzak's not my boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Brian looks over the wall. A dirty puddle separa him from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Brian) Ooooh, like the tie. Love the tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grindle, scrape down that wall for  me, huh? I would myself, but the tie  'n all, y'know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grindle stares at him a beat, then wordlessly steps into muck and pulls free a section of wall, dropping it on the ground in front of Brian. Santos and Grindle look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Brian, if you're lookin' for  smoke patterns, there's some good  ones over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Brian walks over) Little to the right... further...  further... Right behind there. Hey,  could you hand me that pike pole?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a pike pole leaning against the wall. Brian pulls aside. SPLASH -- The pole had been supporting a small, sa piece of ceiling that instantly collapses, dumping twenty gallons of murky, putrid black water all over Brian's civ Nobody laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, maybe that wasn't it after  all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen appears around the corner. Sees what's happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's just about enough, guys, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya around, Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leave. Brian stands there, humiliated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Brian) What the hell's the matter with you,  huh? You're steppin' in the shit  again. You could've done it. You  don't want this. (the suit 'n tie) Wake up, kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian burns with shame and anger as Adcox walks away. Ste hands Brian a towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Dry yourself off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian snatches it from him. Glares at his brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you are sorta making yourself  fair game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the insight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian, look --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just leave me alone, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian walks away. Stephen calls after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Bri... Rimgale's okay. I don't  get half the shit he's talking about,  but then everybody says the same  thing about me. Who the hell knows?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen, Stephen's ex-wife, is sitting at her kitchen when looks up suddenly at a strange sound coming from the roof

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the short, sloping roof, Stephen stands hammering a sh back into place. Helen sticks her head out the dormer win

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen, what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fixing my roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your roof anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops and tosses the hammer aside. Looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Sean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got piano lessons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? How's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to be a fireman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give up, babe. You can't fight it.  Believe me, my mom tried...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Stephen, you gotta stop just showing  up on the roof like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to, I don't know, not  exactly apologize for the other night --  especially since I don't remember  much of it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... I just thought I should say,  I don't know, something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The great communicator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I hit Jackson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He deserved it. He was born deserving  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He treats you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I treated you better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You treated me like shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want some coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee? Nah, I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong, Stephen? (looks at her) C'mon, you only beat up the roof  when something's on your mind. (beat) How's Brian doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know he's out, but how's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know, I treated him better than  any other probie I ever had. He  probably hates my guts, but I did  the best thing for him. I made him  finally look in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah Stephen, that's what this is really  about, isn't it? You always have to  be right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm the first one to admit when  I'm wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? When was the last time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a fire? Never. (beat) Look, I'm his brother. I care about  him, y'know? He was going to get  himself killed. Maybe not today,  maybe not in a year, but it would've  happened. And I couldn't -- I just  couldn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't keep being his father...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen sighs deeply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I realized today? I  can't remember my dad's face anymore.  There's pictures of him staring at  me everywhere I go, but the guy behind  them... he's gone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sighs and hops down from the roof to the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see ya around, Helen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She watches him as he walks lonely up the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Lab Tech, RICCO, leads Brian and Rimgale through the au area till they come on two corpses lying side by side cov in plastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Alan Seagrave and Donald  Cosgrove...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you say so. Brian's stomach does a half-gainer as he's confronted by two hideously charred bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Both deaths due to close encounters  with stationary objects; office door  for Mr. Cosgrove, '89 Porsche for  Mr. Seagrave. No non-relevant traumas.  No significant blood toxicology.  Attitude of both trajectories  consistent with explosions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian is discreetly avoiding his gaze, whistling quietly himself as he looks over specimen jars on a shelf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ran the residue you scraped  from both crispers' front doors.  It's a combination of plumber's putty  and rayophene gum. Burns almost  completely away when you light it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Putty? On both doors?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something else kinda  interesting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricco lifts Benton's charred shoulder. Underneath we see  some of his clothes that have melted and co-mingled with flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A credit card has been fried right into Cosgrove's skin a where his back pocket should have been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess he didn't leave home without  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricco erupts in a honking laugh, then switches instantly  back to a business tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, down here, take a look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCaffrey, hold this for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I don't think that's in my  contract...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just re-wrote your contract.  C'mere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With supreme reluctance Brian pulls the crisper's head an shoulder away from the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, he isn't gonna try to  sell you insurance, lift him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian gathers the torso up and hoists him higher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Rimgale) See that patch of shirt? We wondered  about the discoloration so he ran a  spectro. On a lucky shot we picked  up some traces of Trychticholorate.  Nobody around here had ever heard of  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trychticholorate? Alright, it's an  absorption catalyst in toxic waste  accidents. It's pretty rare, they  stopped making it a couple'a years  ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably got in Cosgrove's clothes  in a gas state from the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell was it doing in the  fire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that instant, Cosgrove's eyes OPEN and his body SIGHS. Brian DROPS the body in shock and backs away, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked you to hold him, not feel  him up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale's FD sedan. Brian is still wringing imaginary gut off his hands. Rimgale tosses an open fire chem book in h lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Trychtichlorate is a binary  structured --"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Go to the bottom. Under heat  properties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "During heat episodes of 2000 Kelvin  or higher, Trych breaks down and  dissipates. Will consume magnesium".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever burned magnesium? It's so hot  it takes water molecules and BAMM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale CLAPS his hands next to Brian's head, STARTLING h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch tears 'em apart just  to eat the oxygen. Wouldn't take  much at all to melt ten gauge wire.  Problem's burnt magnesium leaves a  powder trace -- unless you could  find something that would eat its  residue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trychticholorate. Then Swayzak can  announce Seagrave was a murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale looks at Brian. He's getting tired of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, it isn't proof, okay? Someone  may have put the chemical in the  outlet, but we found it as a vapor  in Cosgrove's clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the putty around the door?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if it was used to seal the air  off, that doesn't explain why someone  would go to the trouble of a  backdraft. A gun's a helluva lot  easier

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the right guess on this is arson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some people say you don't do much of  anything when it comes to this case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't work for them, either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian's sitting at a desk. He's finishing up a huge paper clip Tyrannosaurus. The phone RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Straightest answer your department's  given me all week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Jennifer's calling from her office, she's busy sig papers brought to her and okaying campaign posters as she talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss and I are up to about three  words an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to secretary) Green committed to a thousand. (to Brian) There's another fund-raising party  tonight. Marty'd really like you to  come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I'm kinda swamped here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses a paper airplane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could use a date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well, maybe I can fit it in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCaffrey! Come here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Call ya back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian hangs up quickly and walks back into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale's there, crouched excitedly beside a trash can th lid's been sealed closed. He tamps a piece of putty on th rim and backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the top off. Go ahead. Take it  off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian walks over and RIPS OFF the lid. -- Instantly a ton of flame SHOOTS straight up past his head and BLOWS out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale's grinning like a little kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it! Oh, that son of a bitch,  he's different, goddamn it! You see  what this tells us, huh? Our killer  doesn't love fire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulls out file) I got it after we talked to Ronald.  Torches. Want to fry the whole goddamn  world. But the fires that killed  those guys never really burned up  much. -- The burns were all lit in  outlets surrounded by double  firebreaks in the walls. And he made  his burns backdrafts. ([p. 78])

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he killed these guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he could have killed everybody  there. The firebreaks kept it from  spreading in the wall. The backdraft  blew out the flame. That's it. That's  the reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What reason?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why backdrafts. Whoever fried Seagrave  and Cosgrove went to a helluva lot  of trouble to make sure they died by  fire, but also made sure the fire  blew itself out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why the sealant on the doors...  So what have we got, a torch with a  conscience?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we have a stone killer trying to  make a point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going public with this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Do that and I guarantee you'll  scare him off. I don't want him  running away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Latin band cuts loose as beautiful people mill about ag a beautiful Chicago skyline. An AIR HORN blows, and sudde the skyline is MOVING. We're on a huge, private party boa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian's leaning on the boat railing watching the passing  parade of rich and beautiful. Across the sea of champagne and brie, he spots Jennifer talking with her boss, Swayza He has his hand on her back. Jennifer spots Brian. She smile, detaches herself and wal over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes on Swayzak) Hey... (beat) So are you dating your boss or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you weren't at least the 300th  person to ask me that, I'd probably  be pissed. (beat, sighs) Boy, you sure know it's a man's world  sometimes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. (beat) Are you dating anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think that's really any of your  business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you did invite me here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty did. (beat, smiles) But I wanted you to come to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swayzak suddenly appears with his entourage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. McCaffrey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't mine. (to photographer) Let's get a picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swayzak swings around and puts his arm cheesily around Br shoulder. Another staffer slaps a SWAYZAK FOR MAYOR stick to Brian's lapel. Jennifer rolls her eyes to Brian. I'm  sorry... Snap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing someone else) Larry! (sotto to Jennifer) What does he do again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swayzak leads her off in pursuit. Left alone, Brian turns the railing, stares off at the passing city. You can hear the wind-up of a siren. And there it is now, an engine company zooming along Wack Drive. Something digs and kicks inside of Brian as he wat it disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the job going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's appeared again beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, Rimgale's as slow as a snail,  isn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he's more of a dinosaur. Guy's  not a dummy, though. He's juggling  alot of balls on this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it doesn't take Albert  Einstein just to figure out if these  guys were killed by accidents or  not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, give him a break. There isn't  enough proof yet to go public. Sure,  we found some chemical shit we think  somebody dumped in the plugs to torch  'em, and we've maybe figured out why  backdrafts, but you can't rush this  stuff. Not 'till it's locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Rimgale's probably going to come  around to arson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a dinosaur kinda way, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: BAMM
dialogues.text: Both of them look up sharply. A woman drunk out of her mi has tipped over in her chair. She laughs, her fellow  tablemates laugh, everybody laughs. Jennifer takes Brian the arm in the opposite direction and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band's completely cut loose now. A wild percussion rh that has everyone on their feet dancing like madmen. Bria and Jennifer stomp and sweat and shake and giggle through hair crazily askew. The lakeshore is twinkling and wonder as it slips past. The drums beat faster and harder and th only thing that isn't moving now is their eyes -- eyes lo on each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweaty, flushed with the evening and a few drinks, Brian Jennifer pull up in her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the invite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got anything to drink in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, there might be something stashed  away for emergencies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The regular engine company's gone to bed and the arson sq packed in for the night, leaving the apparatus floor quie and dim as Brian and Jennifer enter. Brian leads her back past the engine and arson sedan to t rear where Rimgale has his offices. As they walk Jennifer eyes drift up to the old sculpted parapets, the press-tin ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is one of the oldest fire  stations in the city. Lotta tradition  locked up in here. What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Homey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See that trap door up there? That  used to lead to the hay loft when  they had horse-drawn engines. It was  pretty different then... but kinda  the same, y'know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you miss it? (he doesn't answer) You seem like you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I came back, I knew more than  anything else that I wanted to be a  fireman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why did you quit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to be a good one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk into the back arson offices. Brian pokes throug few drawers, one or two shelves. Finally he lifts a squat specialized fire extinguisher. The bottom has been hollow out, leaving room for a fifth of bourbon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old firehouse trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pours her a glass. Jennifer takes a generous sip of he turns, brushes past him and breathes,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So show me your fire truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian escorts Jennifer along the side of the behemoth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, our specimen here is your basic  standard issue piece of primary  suppression equipment. This area is  the pumping panel, which controls  the rate of liquid insertion into  the hose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian lifts a narrow, tapered straight-bore nozzle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a six inch playpipe, cast  bronze to keep it firm during hard  flows. (picks up another  item) This is our pipe extender, used in  forward lays... (moves on) This is our hard suction line... Our  adjustable insertion nozzle... (comes around back of  trunk) ...And this is the hose bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. The air cracks between them. And is brushed aside. an instant they're all over each other. Tangled lips and  gulping breaths. Jennifer abruptly breaks it off -- And looks mischievously up at the hose bed, with its l curling rolls of soft cotton. Brian doesn't remember this precise scenario being discus at the academy, but he improvises admirably, popping up o the hose bed and offering a gentlemanly hand to Jennifer. they tumble into the soft folds

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engine 17 roars up, lights flashing, to a high-rise. As t crew jumps down Tim trips and falls flat on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Tim, if you're going to kill  yourself at least wait till the fire,  it's better P.R.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer unbuttons Brian's shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about the playpipe again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls the shirt off his shoulder as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engine 17 walking up to a frazzled security guard in the  lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know. There's alarms going off  on three different floors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They climb into the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cramped on the way up with the bulky coats, helmets, hose rolls, and the tangible nervousness that always goes with this kind of fire. The elevator Musak plays 101 Stri version of "Tie A Yellow Ribbon 'Round The Old Oak Tree".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we know if the floor's going  to be on fire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the doors open and it's hot, don't  get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian pulls off Jennifer's stockings. As she kicks it awa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator stops. DING. The door opens. No howling blaz not even any noise, but enough hanging smoke that you can see your hand in front of your face. They fan out gingerly onto the floor, looking for the fir Hide and seek in a white fog bank. Everybody stops and  listens. Slowly, carefully, they feel their way through t haze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On cue something snakes past behind the walls, whispers a whines and shivers up and over them and then is silent.  Grindle attaches a hoseline to the building standpipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These high-rise gigs give me the  creeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's wait for a back-up, Stephen.  We're early on this one, it hasn't  even broke out yet. We're one short  as it is with Brian gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Stephen's on the hunt now. Obsessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to learn something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen and Tim take the lead, their axes gripped like  shotguns. Grindle backs them up with a charged hoseline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adcox, go with Pengelly and check  the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't safe, man. Don't go splittin'  us up. Not with this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- What the hell's the matter with  you? You always check the other side.  I haven't got time for bullshit right  now, okay? We got a job here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me take the lead, Stephen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it Adcox! Just do your fucking  job!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adcox folds. With a stricken look on his face he takes hi crew down the other way. Stephen and Tim slowly feel thei way.

dialogues.speaker: CRACK
dialogues.text: Everybody SPINS around in terror. Nothing. Something inhu giggles down ahead of them. Stephen smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (like a mantra) Oh, you're so very sly, but so am  I... (to Tim) ...Listen to it... you can tell when  a wall cracks which way it's gonna  jump... you can hear the doors breathe  if they're hot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim looks confused. He doesn't get it. They come to a side door. Stephen runs his hand down the  jam, feels for heat. Then he steps back, takes a deep bre and CRASHES the door down with one AXE BLOW. Quiet inside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian and Jennifer are into the rhythm now, breathing dee On the wall above them are framed photos of dead firemen. Watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen concentrates on the sound of the fire above him, then abruptly turns and CRASHES down another door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian and Jennifer lie in a tight embrace, enjoying the  moment, the lull, as suddenly the lights SNAP ON and an a klaxon BELLOWS. Firemen are coming down the pole now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They frantically climb into their clothes. The firemen ha noticed them as they climb aboard. They've STARTED THE EN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And before either of them realizes it, they're suddenly  pulling out into the street and WAILING off down the bloc The wind's wild in their hair, the siren deafening, the  flashing red lights blinding staccato, And Jennifer loves it. She kisses Brian fiercely, he lets out a war whoop lo in the blast of air, and together they hold each other as the night screams past and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engine 17 pulls up into the parking lot of the high-rise  fire. Firemen leap out of the cab and rush around behind pull off lengths of hose from the bed. As the folds curl  away the fireman is stunned to see a woman's stocking com out with it. With equal shock he looks up and watches as a disheveled grinning Brian and Jennifer climb calmly down out of the  bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen and Tim creep along the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tim) Lotta smoke, but it isn't rolling...  that means it's hiding... staying  sleepy... one of these doors...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim's come to one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Easy... no hurry... you're not going  anywhere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen BANGS down another door. Sticks his head in to ch A little woodpecker toy dips up and down in a glass of wa Tim readies his axe before his door, gathers his courage Stephen comes out of the room he was checking. Sees Tim  lifting his axe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you check the door for heat,  Tim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim doesn't hear. The axe is already up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim's committed now, coming hard at the door. And Stephen sees it for just an instant -- Small tendrils of smoke ed lazily around the door -- then being sucked back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rushes for Tim as Tim's axe SMACKS the door and a whin behind it builds and roars and howls and Tim's all follow through now, hitting the door with his shoulder as  The door EXPLODES OUTWARD, HURLING TIM against the opposi wall and for an instant he's okay but he freezes in terro as A SHRIEKING TONGUE OF FLAME SHOOTS OUT THE DOORWAY and Grindle shouts in horror and opens his hose line as the f wrap Tim like a jealous lover as Adcox hears it and screa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God! Oh God no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Tim's screaming now too, because his helmet, his mask his face, it's all melting and Grindle dives suicidally a the monster, BLASTING it with his hose as Stephen ignores the flames and puts his arms around Tim as Grindle DOUSES them both, killing the flames. The monster rolls wounded back into the room, into the ai shafts as Tim whimpers incoherently, sliding down the wal as Stephen tries to help but oh God you can't tell what's face and what's mask and helmet anymore. Grindle looks back where the fire came from. There's a co in there, burned and lying between two doors. Adcox rushes to Tim's side sobbing and it's the end, the of the goddamn world...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian and Jennifer are having the time of their lives, wh suddenly a group of firemen pass by rushing someone on a  stretcher to an ambulance and Brian sees -- sweet Jesus - it's Tim. Jennifer turns away in horror. They load Tim in the van as Adcox and Grindle jump in to ride along. To ho his hand. Stephen watches the ambulance disappear out into the stre Frustration and fury tear at him as he takes off his coat and slams it to the ground. He kicks it, kicks it till hi strength's gone. He turns, his wounded eyes finding Brian

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale walks down the smokey corridor. The charred civil is there, sitting in the short stretch of hall between tw blown doors. Through the haze Rimgale sees Stephen crouch in the interior room, picking at the debris. Lost in hims

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Stevie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen stands and looks around the room, seemingly unawa of Rimgale. He walks wordlessly straight out past him, hi eyes streaming with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian shoulders his way through the emergency room. He pa a small alcove full of vending machines. Adcox is there,  sipping a paper cup, leaning against the machine in deep  anguish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Further down the hall is ICU. Grindle and Santos are ther sitting outside the room, raw and weary. Grindle nods to  Brian. Everyone's still stained and smudged from the fire Everyone but Brian. Brian looks through a door window into the room. There,  surrounded by doctors and physicians, lies Tim. He's been cut out of his uniform. Gauze bandages everywhere. As a p of forceps peel some away Brian glimpses what used to be face, now only reds and browns and leaky whites. He turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they think he'll pull through?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have been there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of us should have been there,  Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Voices rise down the hall. Turn to shouts. It's Adcox and Stephen, tearing heartbreakingly into one another. Brian  can't make out the words but it's ugly, emotional. Abrupt it ends and Stephen emerges from the alcove, walking towa them upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had to do it, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen's got other things on his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Not now, Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had to take on another fire bare- handed, huh? Had to be fucking myth  man in there instead of looking out  for your probie. Is that what  happened? Is it, Stephen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had that fire. He didn't listen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't listen? He was a fucking  candidate! He was your responsibility.  He shouldn't have been there in the  first place, Stephen. (beat) You burned him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian grabs his arm. Stephen SNAPS and roughly PUSHES Brian, knocking him agai the wall. Brian comes off it in a flash and is all over  Stephen. They go down and it's all thrashing and shouting now. A horrible, endless draw. Grindle and Santos are in pulling them apart, holding them up against opposite wall Both brothers glare at one another, tears filling their e Brian shakes Grindle off and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian sits staring blankly. A newspaper drops in front of him. FIRE DEPT. SAYS IT'S MURDER. Rimgale stands above hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goes on about how the break was made  through the discovery of "chemical  traces" and a "behavioral link". Oh,  and Swayzak's quoted saying the chief  investigator is closing in on the  torch and expects an arrest "any  time".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian's eyes wince closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your stuff and get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's pouring some coffee as Brian bursts in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Brian. What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told Swayzak about our arson  lead. It's all over the fucking news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know it was a secret. There  aren't supposed to be secrets between  the city and its investigators --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Bullshit! You knew what I told  you wasn't ready for the papers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you please keep your voice down,  there's people --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You could have scared the son of  a bitch off. We may never bust him  now. All for a couple's political  points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was doing my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabs her arm) Yeah? And just how much of all this  has been "doing your job"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes it off) Let me ask you something, do you  really think Marty had you assigned  to arson because of your firefighting  skills? Who the hell are you kidding?  I was there, remember? I saw you and  your brother --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave Stephen out of this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, he's the real fireman. (beat) Who are you? Just another probie  working for Swayzak --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I work for the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew what we were asking you to  do. Don't suddenly pull out a  conscience now. The fit isn't right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swayzak appears in the doorway. He looks haggard, as if h hasn't slept. There's something haunted in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. McCaffrey... Keeping busy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. In fact, I just dropped off a  letter to the Times explaining how  yesterday's arson announcement was a  fabrication by your office. They  loved it. And you know what? You  were right, my family background in  firefighting gave it weight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Brian...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian shoulders his way past Swayzak and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian walks up to Tim's room. Stephen's sitting there, ra looking. Inside the young probie lies wrapped in tubes an gauze and years of wasted promise. An EKG beeps, a respir hisses, and Brian gulps down something heavy in his throa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gonna live. Maybe not much else,  but he's gonna live...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Rimgale gets out of his car a limousine pulls up. Sway opens the rear door from inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inspector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alderman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cruising through traffic. Swayzak is disheveled, unshaven fidgety. A man who hasn't slept and had a few drinks befo the one he's pouring now. He offers one to Rimgale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I usually have breakfast first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swayzak apparently doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When are you going to catch the prick  that's doing this, Don?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Don?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you have any leads at all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Marty, I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the first time, Rimgale sees real fear on Swayzak's f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We still haven't found a connection  between the victims.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, open your eyes! Seagrave,  Cosgrove, and now Holcomb -- fried  in a goddamn high-rise!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holcomb? I didn't know the name of  that victim had even been released  yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sedan stops back at arson HQ. They'd gone around the  block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale opens the door, climbs out, lingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a connection between them,  Alderman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just catch the son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door shuts and Swayzak roars away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale walks back into his offices. He's surprised to se Brian there working at his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm finished with Swayzak. I'll do  whatever you want me to do. I just  want to help catch the guy that burned  Tim. You gotta give me another shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale stares at Brian, appraises him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CLOSE UP of Rimgale POPPING the molding around the door frame of Holcomb's burned office. Underneath can be seen  traces of the same white residue from the other fires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought 'ol Marty was acting a  little strange... And he's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale rubs the white powder between his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Backdraft?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale stands at the spot in the short hall where the bo lied between two doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The backdraft was set somewhere in  there. It fried Holcomb when he opened  the inner door. But the outer door  held... and waited for Tim...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian steps into the inner office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So find me the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian begins searching, probing. He finally stands. Defea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're thinking too much of the  building and not enough of the ghost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian's eyes don't understand. From Rimgale's coat comes plastic flask. He pours out of it a liquid onto the floor and lights a match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a word, Brian, what is this job  all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale drops the match. WUMP. A small flame explodes to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a living thing, Brian. It  breathes, it eats, and it hates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire's climbing a wall, chewing a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only way to beat it is to think  like it. To know that this flame  will spread this way across the floor  not because of the physics of  flammable liquids or heat convection,  but because it wants to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FWUMP. It darts west. Licks the ceiling. The fire purrs a hisses. Stretches luxuriously and attacks savagely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some guys on this job, fire owns  them. It makes them fight on its  level. But the only way to truly  kill it is to love it a little, just  like Ronald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian stares at the flame. A goblin reaching out for him. Woosh! Rimgale hits it with a fire extinguisher. In an in the goblin is gone, the genie in the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you guys doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young woman's entered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're the fire department, lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well color me stupid, I always thought  the fire dept. put out fires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to woman) You work here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Till yesterday. What do you think  the odds are that a non-refundable  ticket to Paris survived this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somewhere between zero and no way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. What a mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seem real broken up about Mr.  Holcomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff Holcomb? The Darth Vader of tax  accountants? He was a sleezeball.  Hopefully a sleezeball that carried  some insurance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go talk to the building owner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was the building owner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our book lists the owner as Dekom  Trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him like he's the dumbest human she's met al week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't investigators come in adult  size?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen's lying sprawled on his bunk, his hands pressed o his eyes. There's a voice outside the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stevie? Rimgale's here to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just wants to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I'm busy goddamn it, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, then Rimgale himself enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, they don't knock on your planet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale takes in Stephen's room, the half empty bourbon  bottle. Without a word, Rimgale walks over and pours it o He sits down beside Stephen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still haven't gotten your fire  report, Stevie. On Tim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wave of pain rolls through Stephen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I deal with this stuff every day.  But a fireman... you never get used  to it. (beat) What happened up there? He was a  candidate. Did he pay attention? Was  he listening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...He wasn't listening to the right  thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you listen to, Stephen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know... nobody knows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen's eyes meet Rimgale's and hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It knows us. This one knows us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) I need that report, Lt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen takes Rimgale's notebook out of his lap, rips out page, and writes angrily in huge block letters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim-went-to-the-fire-and-now-he- doesn't-have-a-face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen throws the sheet at Rimgale, stands, and walks ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Escher drawing of a place, endlessly vast racks spun a an open central core. High up, lost among its rows, Brian going through rack after rack of dog-eared record books a Rimgale enters down below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to hold it  together in his mind) Hey boss, Dekom Trust is owned by  Pan Illinois... which is majority  controlled by Lakeside Dynamics...  which is a division of Windy City  Ventures... who's partners are... (beat) Alan Seagrave, Donald Cosgrove, and  Jeffrey Holcomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch. They knew each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More books. Files. Acres of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Seagrave and Holcomb were  accountants...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Cosgrove. Coppers figured he  laundered money for the mob before  getting into real estate. They weren't  very high on Seagrave, either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice bunch of guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who all ended up wearing candles for  faces... (beat) Swayzak's up to his ass in this  somehow. Guy can barely hold a drink  in his hand, he's so scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, then he looks directly at Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to get a look at his files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With glowing skyscrapers leaping up in the background, it an unexpectedly quiet, serene place along the lake. Jenni sits alone at a bench, watching an ancient fisherman look for dinner, as Brian walks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We still talking? (beat) Look, I'm sorry about the other day --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swayzak knows something about the  guys that were murdered. I want to  know why he keeps that hidden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know anything about it.
