dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could check. It'd be in his files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Do you know what you're asking me to  do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know, four years ago I was working  in a bakery. Two years ago I was  bringing Marty coffee and he didn't  even know my name. I run that office  now. Marty believed in me and I  believe in him. You want me to just  throw that away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your boss is lying, Jennifer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it hangs between them, two people lonely on the edge the lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a workbench, under a single lamp, Stephen stands among a confusion of tools, wire, And a wall socket. With a pair of pliers, he tugs at something within the so puts the face-plate back on and screws it down. He stares it, and we feel the sudden wave of hopelessness cascading through him. He sets the socket back down -- and SCATTERS everything a in a single, furious move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen's sits quietly against Helen's back door, lost in himself. A light comes on. Helen opens the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits down beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... I... couldn't sleep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... (beat) It used to be, when I was a kid,  what meant most to me about this job  was there were no ifs. Life and death,  right and wrong. When someone called  the fire department, we came... Those  guys don't know how much I love  them... You don't leave people  hanging... cause that's what it's  all about. It's loyalty. It's 'till  death do us part. Isn't that what  you heard?... It's you go, we go...  Cause without that, it's the end of  families, it's the end of the fire  department... and when the fire  department stops coming... that's  the end of the fucking world... (beat) I'm sorry I came, Helen, it's just...  it's just there's nobody I can talk  to... (beat) I miss you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moment lingers, grows heavy and grey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen and Helen in bed, holding each other...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, and Stephen dressed, making eggs for three. Sean there, lending a hand, beaming as Stephen tries to show h how to flip an egg. Helen enters in her robe. He kisses h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cook and I are almost finished here.  Have a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen... I... can I talk to you a  second...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen musses his son's hair and follows her out into th hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm sorry I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- No, that's okay. It's just Sean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- He's gettin' good on those eggs.  And y'know, he told me he actually  likes the piano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to confuse him, Stephen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blow's so long and hard and deep you don't even see i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's... It's just things have  changed... you're the same, Stephen,  but things are different now... you've  got a son... you're the best at what  you do Stephen, you always were, but  you scare me now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, Sean sticks his head into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sean) Hey... Sean-man, your dad blew it. I  forgot I had to work this morning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw dad, c'mon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time, huh? We'll do it up big.  Promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen's turned away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. (then sotto) Mom's crying, dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer enters Swayzak's inner office. His chair's turne away toward the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding print-out) Latest polls came in, Marty. (he doesn't answer) Marty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally the chair turns, revealing a haunted man. Polls a far from his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, Marty, what's going  on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees a fire department file on the murders open on hi desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've come a long way together, Marty.  I've staked my whole career on you.  And now you're sneaking around this  office, leaking things to the papers  behind my back... (beat) Is there something you're not telling  me about these deaths?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swayzak's eyes are dead metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he turns his chair around again. Jennifer stands ther beat. -- Then turns to the filing cabinets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian drives up and parks. He's half way to the staircase when he sees someone sitting in the dark in a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him a manila envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a dumb thing to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cavernous hall full of dozens of fire trucks loaded on  jacks. Rimgale's sedan's there, the repairman shaking his head in amazement at the undercarriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell do you do with this  thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale's looking through the report Brian's handed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the copy of Swayzak's manning  report that was released. Everybody  on this job knows it's bullshit but  we could never argue with the numbers.  They're all airtight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Airtight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dumps three more reports on Rimgale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got three different drafts of  the same report -- with different  numbers that're all over the place.  Looks like they were just making it  up as they went along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did a little check on the consulting  firm that wrote the report. They did  exactly one job -- Swayzak's manpower  study. It's not even really a company.  No employees, no directors, just a  PO Box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then who wrote the report?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It had to be someone who knows  numbers. Some kind of fancy  accountant. But what's the connection?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian hands him something else. A photograph. Swayzak and the other three, posing on a fishing boat, 1970. Time of  their lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's time Mr. Swayzak and us  had a little heart to heart talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The red arson sedan pulls up to wealthy home. Rimgale and Brian walk up and knock on the door -- it creaks open aja They push the door open slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark as they enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Swayzak?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian and Rimgale split up down different halls. It's the HISS Brian hears first. Then the FLASH of an electrical s FLARING ice-cold cobalt blue. Suddenly the room's dimensi are there in frantic, strobing shadows. Chairs, a couch - -- And a figure that JUMPS Brian. the light from the burn plug is a fierce strobe as the figure, a confused shadow, crashes Brian to the floor. They STRUGGLE. The figure GRABS Brian's throat. Brian PUSHES him back -- Against the burning wall plug. The figure SHRIEKS in p gets his hand on a crowbar and SLAMS Brian -- who crumple dazed. The figure stands -- just as Rimgale TACKLES him. figure CRASHES across a gas space heater, SNAPPING the  connection off. The figure SLAMS Rimgale HARD with the  crowbar, squirms free, and stumbles out the door. Hissss... Rimgale climbs to his feet as fire eats at the  wall. A baby backdraft wagging its tail. He goes to a daz Brian's side, lifting him by his armpits and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: helping him outside. Hissss... The ruptured space heater  pumps gas furiously. Rimgale sees that. He also sees a be door ajar on the far side of the house. And through the d a couch. And on the couch, A body. Hissss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale rushes back inside. It's Swayzak, unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale drags him out on the stoop beside Brian just as t gas WHUMPS and the doors and windows EXPLODE in a HOWLING FIREBALL, the shrapnel BLOWING Rimgale off his feet. Bria slowly shakes his head clear. He looks around, tries to o himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... I sorta got a problem here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian climbs up to his feet and walks over to where Rimga lies at a weird angle, a piece of wrought iron fence punc through his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale lies in an emergency room bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well Brian, I guess you can say it's  arson now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How ya feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale grunts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you pull me out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I say thanks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just wondering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate hospitals. You're so... so  goddamn useless...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale suddenly kicks the bed frame in anger. He kicks i over and over with frustration till something finally SNA off. Brian waits, let's him vent his frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you want me to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been lying here hours... just  thinking... We're close... (beat) We're not looking in the right place,  Brian. This one knows us and we're  not looking in the right place...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian's sitting alone in a chair. Finally the opposite do opens and in enters Ronald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Mr. Life magazine. Come all  this way just to say hi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian hands him a stack of murder files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm close... but I can't get who it  is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you came to me... (smiles) Well, this is going to be an  interesting afternoon after all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ronald starts to read the files

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian still sitting there. Watching Ronald devour the  statistics. The photos of charred bodies. Ronald finishes leans back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, here's the deal. I'll tell you  a story, you tell me one. Fair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your first question should be who  isn't. It isn't a spark, Brian. Not  enough damage. And an insurance pro?  Where's the profit margin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then who --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- No no, your turn. Tell me a story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronald drops on the table a dog-eared copy of that 1972 L magazine with Brian on the cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Famous story even. Straight burn.  Just an engine and truck first on  scene. What did you feel, Brian,  when you first got there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta tell a story too, Brian.  It's fair. C'mon, don't think too  hard --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I thought it was great. I loved  it. It was nothing to these guys...  medium deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Light smoke, low roll. Couple'a  civilians hollering -- medium deal.  So young fireman Adcox and Captain  McCaffrey, they head up stairs, get  out on the fire escape -- McCaffrey  does the ballsy jump across... what  were you feeling, Brian? (Brian doesn't answer) C'mon, you promised. Be honest. (Brian just stares) Okay... Guard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I wanted to be him. Right then I  wanted to be him more than anything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Very good, Brian. -- About your report  here. The way to a torch's heart is  through his tools. That's how you  know him. It's the way he talks to  the fire. And to you if you listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The outlets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a probie answer. You're smarter  than that, Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trychticholorate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. -- So our two heroes, Adcox  and McCaffrey, they go back inside.  Only there's another fire in there  nobody sees. And it took your dad,  didn't it Brian? Did you see him  burn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a flash, Brian suddenly reaches across and grabs Ronal by the collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck is doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After it took your dad... the fire...  did it look at you Brian? Did it  talk to you?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Ronald sees something in Brian's eyes. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, our world's aren't so  different...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian releases Ronald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet) Who's doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The arsonist smiles a creepy, horrible grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think, Brian. Who doesn't love fire,  but knows it better than anyone else?  Who's around trychticholorate 24  hours a day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cold shock rolls through Brian as he slumps back in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus Christ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not such a far walk after all, is  it, Brian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian climbs up onto Stephen's boat. Nobody home. He open the cabin door, goes inside and hits the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's cereal bowls in the sink, beer bottles on the tab And a stack of fire department supplies in the corner. His whole body aching with reluctance, Brian begins looki through them. Solvents, Armorall, a small specialty can o fire dept. chemicals. There's a label of ingredients on i Way down at the bottom, Is trychticholorate. Nausea wrack its way through Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh goddamn it Stephen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Footsteps. Brian spins around in stone shock as Stephen c into the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just... Just wanted to say hello...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian backs away from the chemicals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, long as you're here you can  help clean up a little. I've got a  guy coming to look at this in a few  minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're selling dad's boat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's just another memory in my  life right now. And I got way too  many of them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really should get back. There's...  there's something I'm supposed to  do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? What have you got to do? (beat) Look at you. Look at your face. All  the things you must be thinking.  Man, you must really hate my guts.  Well, you know what? It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Stephen, maybe we can talk  about this some other --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Okay, so you don't like me. You  don't like everything I've done.  What, because I wasn't such a genius  the way I raised you? Jesus Christ,  dad was gone, what was I supposed to  do? You tell me, what the fuck was I  supposed to do?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He KICKS the bulkhead wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Stephen, I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I tried, y'know? Helen's right. I  don't have all the answers, but  goddamn it, I've got some. (beat) Look, you're gonna do what you have  to, and maybe I shouldn't have gotten  in the way. I'm your brother, not  your father. Go on. You gotta go  somewhere? Go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian turns to leave. Pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saw what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When dad died, I saw another fire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw it before it got them. I tried  to yell, but... He asked me to look  out for him. And I didn't do it. I  let him die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) ...Jesus, you been carrying that  around for twenty years? For christ's  sake, you were seven years old! You  think he could have heard you in  there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate him so much sometimes, Stephen.  You don't know how hard it was for  me to put that uniform on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I do. (sighs) ...What a fuckin' mess, huh? (beat) People can change Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes right when you're looking  at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian sees the chemicals in the corner again and somethin freezes up inside. Stephen catches the look and there's  horrible silence between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, Stephen, what's going on  with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Brian... I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian stands before the fire station. His brother's and h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian PRIES the lock off Stephen's locker. Starts looking through it. Adcox comes out of the shower with a towel on starts shaving in a mirror. He doesn't notice Brian. Adco turns to head for his own locker and the towel slips a li And Brian's universe caves in. An icy claw tears out his stomach. Gulping breaths, he fo himself to look at Adcox's back. On it is a small, rectangular burn. It's fresh and it's t size of a wall socket. At that moment Adcox turns. The tw of them stare at one another just a beat, then Adcox walk past him. Just then the alarm bells RING. Brian hesitates beat, confused, then turns and runs down to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where firemen are scurrying around, suiting up. Brian loo frantically for Stephen, sees him out back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathless) -- Stephen, wait a minute. I gotta  talk to you. It's Adcox, he's --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw Adcox's back! I saw the burn!  I put it there! Jesus Christ, Stephen,  he's been killing people!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew when you came looking for the  chemicals. Looking for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- What were they doing there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were for the fucking boat, Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grindles sticks his head out the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta roll, Stevie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're waitin' man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be there, goddamn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grindle goes back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Brian) Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we going to do about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll handle it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta go to Rimgale, Stephen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm his Lt. He's my responsibility.  I'll handle it. Me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen turns and walks toward the station. Brian's eyes go to a window just above it. There, watchin him, watching the whole exchange between brothers, is Adc Adcox stares at Brian a beat, then finally disappears as  Brian hears the cough of diesel engines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Christ. Stephen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts running for the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- It's too late. Adcox climbs aboard just as the engine  company pulls out and whistles down the street. The ladder company is just easing onto the drive. Brian  hesitates only an instant, then runs to the equipment rac PULLS off the hooks his helmet, coat, boots -- and jumps  onto the truck as it takes off in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it howls down the avenue, Stephen turns around and sta at Adcox sitting behind. The glimmer of an understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The laddermen look confused seeing Brian sitting among th A CAR Suddenly CUTS the truck company off. The driver SLA the brakes, PUSHING the truck company into a HORRIBLE SKI The back fishtails, the wheels JUMP the curb, BASH a mail and then the whole rig ROLLS onto its side and DRAGS to a stop. It's tangled confusion in the rear cab. Firemen, unhurt,  piled atop one another. Brian slides his way out from und them and looks down the street where plumes of smoke rise six blocks away. He starts running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flames and smoke curl from a huge industrial warehouse al the river as Brian, panting, runs up. He searches frantic through the maze of arriving engine companies, looking fo number 17. There it is but nobody's home. Brian stops a  passing captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they? Where's 17?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian looks up at the smoke and whirling firestorm four  stories above him, feels the bile of fear in his throat, desperation, -- And begins strapping on an air tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian, now fully suited up, climbs the endless rungs of a extended aerial ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tongues of flame ROCKET skyward through ragged holes. Bla clouds drift murderously, roofing tars bubble and hiss as the roof itself GROANS like a comatose dinosaur, remindin you the whole thing could go any minute -- and you with i Trudging alone across this alien, spongy surface, Brian l for his company. It's almost impossible to tell anyone ap faces hidden behind helmets and masks. Suddenly a cloud of smoke clears and there's two firemen  near the edge, "17" on their helmets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helmets look up. Stephen and Adcox. Facing each other Adcox cradles an axe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian starts to move beside Stephen but Adcox turns, tigh his grip on the axe, and now all the cards are on the tab A hissing black cloud drifts through. They're the only th people on earth. Adcox's eyes are clouded with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw man, Stephen, listen to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- What the fuck were you thinking,  huh? Burning people? You're a fireman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were killing firemen, man. When  Sally showed me what was in Swayzak's  files... They were my friends, I had  to do it. I had to do it for the  department.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you do it for Tim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pain, to Stephen) That was an accident! Jesus Christ,  why did you have to go in there so  fucking early? Why didn't you listen  to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian and Stephen are backed up against the roof edge --  sixty feet up. Far below a fireboat has begun pumping a  massive stream at the side of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta let me finish --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just come down, John. Just --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Shut up! Your dad would fucking  puke if he saw how you've shit on  his department!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Knock it off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Stephen) -- You can't let him turn you against  your friends, man --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- He killed people --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You know what Swayzak would do to  the department if this got out? --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Stephen, this is bullshit --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- What he would do to your dad's  department? You gotta let me finish  it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there's a horrible glimmer of confusion on Stephen's  face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're his Lt., Stephen... (beat) Are you gonna handle it? Are you  Stephen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What do you want me to do, Stephen?  Talk to me. What am I supposed to  do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) There's a fire. We've got a job here.  Let's get on with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of the crews are totally oblivious to what's  happening through the smoke on the other side. Grindle an Santos feel the roof go suddenly spongy beneath them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit... It's going! Clear the roof!  Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody drops their equipment and runs for the edges as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian, Stephen and Adcox react as the roof HOWLS and GROA and huge SPLITS begin racing along it. And then it goes. The center section DROPS, and in rolling waves of SCREECH steel, the hole spreads outward; DEVOURING. Adcox shoves them aside and runs for his life as the hole races for them, SWALLOWING roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ Brian, run! Run goddamn  it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Brian balls-out dashes for the edge. Stephen's made o corner, Brian desperately heads for another. At the last  instant -- as the HOWLING FLAME BELLOWS UP to his ankles Brian LEAPS OFF the roof --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And falls half a story before CRASHING onto an exterio fire escape. Flames have cut off the fire escape two floo below, so Brian climbs down as far as possible, crawls on a ledge, KICKS out a window, steps through, And falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blackness and emptiness, two stories of it, before he CRA into a pool of water at the bottom. He's in a freight ele shaft, thrashing madly, drowning. Great SHEETS of WATER a POURING through an upper doorway and CASCADING down like  monsoon rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see it's coming from the fireboat's rushing stream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The weight of his equipment is pulling Brian underwater.  Struggling against the insane swirls and the sheets of wa still POURING DOWN, Brian unhooks his air tank. He leans  back, tries to float on the rising column of water. -- Hi coat catches on something -- YANKS him underwater. He  struggles feverishly -- finally tears the coat off. The building GROANS in earnest. Flaming chunks of plaster CRASH down around Brian, forcing him to duck underwater. place is coming apart. Ten feet above, one of the falling chunks SMACKS a gas ma SPLITTING then IGNITING it. A white-hot JET OF FLAME SHOO from one side of the shaft to the other. Brian's floating okay, he's floating right up into the fl Brian tries to flatten himself out, to keep everything bu his nose below water, but he's still moving up -- the hea becoming so intense his face flares and he's ducking unde water now, trying to stay alive, trying to decide whether drown or burn -- -- When there's a CRASH. And suddenly another door on the shaft is tearing open. There's a glint of an axe. A  flashlight. It's Stephen. Brian has about two seconds left. In that time Stephen se the shut-off for the gas line mounted on the wall opposit It's unreachable, a good twelve feet across a horizontal  curtain of flame. Before we can even assimilate that,  Stephen's already jumped. A crazy leap over the fire. He  SMACKS the opposite wall, HITS the shut-off, and FALLS  CRASHING into the pool beside Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You crazy son of a bitch, why couldn't  you stay behind a desk where you  belong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "You never know till the fire stares  you down if you're gonna be --"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shut up, huh? (grimaces) I think I broke my goddamn arm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian helps him stay above water. The level continues to  rise, bringing them finally even with an open doorway the scramble through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It leads to a stairwell that's become a RAGING TORRENT of water spilling down it. No way. They push through to the  next doorway and out onto

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is full of hundreds of chemical drums. The fire has cracked its way into the room as WUMP -- drums begin  EXPLODING, SHOOTING UPWARD Roman candle fountains of  glittering FLAME. Brian helps Stephen as they snake their way past sweating drums -- pressure valves hissing madly  with desperation. They duck low, round a corner,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And walk right into an axe handle that SMACKS Brian's  throat KNOCKING him gasping flat on his back. It's Adcox. Stephen JUMPS Adcox and TACKLES him on the edge of a meta platform that extends out from the raised flooring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stupid son of a bitch! What the  fuck are you doing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stevie... I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adcox struggles against him, heaving and sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let it go! Goddamn it let it go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Adcox releases the axe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... I'm so sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian's on his feet now, coming toward them, when a chemi drum below EXPLODES, the shock wave BUCKLING the platform and DROPPING it several feet before it HOLDS. Brian, cut- off, is HIT with a wall of debris. Adcox and Stephen are FLUNG across the platform and THROU the shattered railing. Stephen grabs a piece of broken,  dangling strut and hangs on with one hand. In his other hand is Adcox. Hanging below him, his grip  loosening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian's struggling to get out from under the debris. The  railing Stephen's hanging onto is slick, his hand SLIPPIN along it. But he won't let go of Adcox. His eyes bore int his best friend's with absolute conviction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go, we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The towering shots of FLAME from below have begun to IGNI Adcox's pant leg. He's starting to burn. But Stephen won' let go. Won't let go even as the flames crawl up Adcox's  back. And Stephen's hand is slipping and slipping and the it isn't slipping anymore because it's come off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adcox and Stephen FALL. There's a narrow catwalk half-way down. Stephen HITS with a sickening CRUNCH. Adcox falls past it, down into the flames. There's an exposed I-beam running from the ruined platfor out over the catwalk. Brian climbs up onto it, balances a over the fire below and jumps down to the catwalk where h brother lies, battered but still alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna be all right, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian looks down and across the factory floor. There, com through the doorway, is Pengelly and Nightengale with a  hoseline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Over here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start for him when another drum EXPLODES, FLATTENING them and launching their hoseline into a crazy, thrashing arc. The flame has cut them off from the hose. Stephen se what Brian's thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait for another hose team...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Brian's already moving for the catwalk ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait for the goddamn hose team!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian puts his feet on the outside rungs of the ladder an SLIDES down to the factory floor. He's heading for the  hoseline when WHAM! -- The fire cuts him off. Not just an fire. That same one from so many years ago. Don't fuck with me, kid. I'm not in the mood. Nightengale's lost his helmet and it's lying near the fla spinning slowly upside down -- just like his father's. Br stands there, paralyzed, as the fire laughs at him. Same little kid with his finger up his ass. Then something  different comes into Brian's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... No more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a pathetic little wall extinguisher mounted on th pole. Brian lifts it, approaches the fire. You can practi hear the flames laugh at him. Brian suddenly turns and SL the neck of the extinguisher against the pole, BREAKING i off before HEAVING the cannister HISSING into the flames  where it EXPLODES -- a cloud of extinguisher powder that  STUNS the flames just long enough for Brian to dash throu and TACKLE the hose. The fire shakes off the powder, rises up to kill -- Just Brian spins and HITS it with the STREAM. -- And it's like a howling train wreck as the two grapple with each other -- Pengelly and Nightengale have an openi and they're dashing for the catwalk ladder up to Stephen  because the fire doesn't care -- it only has eyes for Bri now -- -- And Stephen sees Brian tackle the monster, and his eye fill with tears -- -- And the fire's pushing Brian -- pushing him with the f of a frightened street bully -- but Brian won't give -- a now the fire's back's broken -- it's whimpering, dying. And Pengelly and Nightengale have climbed up to Stephen n pulling him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my brother! That's my brother  goddamn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the fire's just a little gremlin now, sighing sadly a Brian steps up with the hoseline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another time, friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And whoosh, it's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian rushes up as paramedics load his brother into an  ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles, weak) You are such a pain in the ass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Brian jumps in with him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paramedics swarm over Stephen as the ambulance screams th the night. Brian's right there, holding his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell them about Adcox... Don't  let 'em...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... I'm sorry I thought...  I won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His brother squeezes Brian's hand, his eyes never leaving him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading EKG) Oh shit, give him some lidocaine,  now. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Who's your brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen's EKG's begun to falter. The other paramedic fire off an injection into his IV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His pressure's fading -- push some  adrenalin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The EKG's become erratic. Stephen's eyes never leave Bria

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man, don't you die... Don't you  die...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going south... He's gonna box  damn it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They put an ambo bag over Stephen's face. The eyes never  leave Brian's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it don't you die now... Not  now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're breathing for him now. The EKG begins shrieking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: V-fib!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The paramedics begin scrambling to load the defibrillator pads on Stephen's chest. But the fireman's eyes never wav from Brian. They look into his with complete conviction,  complete acceptance, And then they don't.

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO BLACK
dialogues.text: Then, FADE UP TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A silent, quiet street absolutely empty of traffic. Then  over the crest of Chicago's mightiest thoroughfare, creep slowly a fire engine. It's emergency lights are on but no the siren. This engine isn't in a hurry today. Behind comes another fire engine. And another. Ten, twent all of them creeping slowly along. And behind the engines now walk firemen in their dress blues. Hundreds of them.  Walking silently in step behind

dialogues.speaker: TWO COFFINS
dialogues.text: Loaded in the rear of Engine 17. Santos drives as Grindle Brian, and the men of ladder company 46, walk behind. The silent procession passes under extended aerial ladders cr like dress swords. Average people stop, take their hats o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two coffins, lying side by side, draped in the blue and w of the Chicago flag. A single fire helmet rests atop each casket. Brian stands at attention beside Helen. He holds the hand Stephen's son Sean, his eyes clouded with tears as a fire dept. honor guard plays Taps. Jennifer's there, too far a to touch. Rimgale, still wearing a head bandage, stands stiffly bes a brass bell and speaks with a voice raw and weary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the Chicago Fire Department the  alarm code 3-3-5 signifies that the  company has returned home to quarters.  We will now ring out that code to  welcome home John Adcox and Stephen  McCaffrey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a small hammer Rimgale rings out 3-3-5 on the bell. The honor guard folds the flag covering Stephen's casket hands it to Helen, who holds it to her breast as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sea of blue uniforms drifting across green as the funer breaks up. Brian hugs Helen and Sean. Lets them go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale's there, resting against his dept. sedan as Brian walks by, pauses, and leans on it beside him. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother was a good man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another couple of good men get burned  up for their city? Is that how it's  going to read? (Brian doesn't answer) You're the only one that knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like it never happened...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale turns to walk back to his sedan. He pauses. Looks back to Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to help me with something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An elevator opens as Brian and Rimgale walk quickly out,  down a hall, and BURST into Swayzak's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Alderman's there, giving a press conference from his  desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Swayzak! How ya doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) Investigator...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale sits on Swayzak's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a little busy right now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This'll only take a minute. There's  two cops outside that want to ask  you about this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rimgale drops the manning report on Swayzak's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is just a guess of course, but  I think they're gonna want to know  why you secretly paid Donald Cosgrove,  Jeffrey Holcomb and Alan Seagrave to  create a phony manpower study. (to cameras) You guys'll wait, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room explodes with questions. Through the din Brian l over the desk very close to Swayzak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See that glow flashing in the corner  of your eye? That's your career  dissipation light. And it just went  into high gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian turns and pushes his way out. At the door he pauses and looks back at Rimgale. The investigator nods and smil just a little...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Brian walks down it, Rimgale appears and calls to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't keep looking over your shoulder  for the ghost. It's gone now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there's just a beat between the investigator and his  probie before Brian nods and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian walks down the hall. He passes Jennifer's small off She's in there, surrounded by packing boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think your boss is going to need  some spin control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I quit two days ago, Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) What'll you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have the slightest idea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see ya around, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a small town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And morning breaking across the avenues and up against th tired brick of firehouse 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian sits staring into his locker, lost in thought, his  equipment stacked up on the bench beside him. THE ALARM K

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And firemen scurrying to their equipment on the apparatus floor. They're climbing aboard their rigs now and the pum diesel is coughing to life. At the last moment, as it begins to pull out, Brian comes sliding down the pole in his turn-out gear, bounces off t floor, and climbs aboard as the engine WHISTLES away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a new fireman beside him on the bench. He can't g his coat buckled right. Brian leans over does it for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're doing it wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the fire engine slips away from us, down the avenue,  into the city as we
